sen.j: 広沢局（ひろさわのつぼね、元亀3年（1573年） - 寛永14年（1637年））は、肥前国垣添城主名護屋経勝の娘で豊臣秀吉の側室。
sen.e: Hirosawa no tsubone (1572 - 1637) was a daughter of Tsunemasa NAGOYA who was the lord of Kakizoe-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and one of Hideyoshi's concubines.
Hirosawa no tsubone (1572 - 1637) was a daughter of Tsunemasa NAGOYA who was the lord of Kakizoe-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and one of the Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubines.
sen.cmt: Hideyoshi's→Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's と修正し、the を挿入しました。
sen.e: Hirosawa no tsubone (1572 - 1637) was a daughter of Tsunemasa NAGOYA who was the lord of Kakizoe-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and one of the Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubines.
Her name was Hiroko (広子).
Her name was Hiroko (広子).
sen.cmt: 「広子」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: Her name was Hiroko (広子).

sen.j: 広子は20歳だったがまだ独身で、文禄・慶長の役のため、1592年の四月に名護屋城に来た秀吉の側室になった。
sen.e: Although Hiroko (広子) was a single at the age of 20, she became a concubine of Hideyoshi who came to Nagoya-jo Castle for the Bunroku-Keicho War in April, 1592.
Hiroko (広子) was still unmarried at the age of 20, she became a concubine of Hideyoshi who came to Nagoya-jo Castle for the Bunroku-Keicho War in April, 1592.
sen.cmt: Although→still, a single→unmarried と修正しました。
sen.e: Hiroko (広子) was still unmarried at the age of 20, she became a concubine of Hideyoshi who came to Nagoya-jo Castle for the Bunroku-Keicho War in April, 1592.

sen.j: その後、秀吉は山里丸の一角に広沢寺を建立した。
sen.e: After that, Hideyoshi erected Koutaku-ji Temple in a corner of Yamazato-maru.
After that, Hideyoshi built Kotaku-ji Temple in a corner of Yamazato-maru.
After that, Hideyoshi built Kotaku-ji Temple in a corner of Yamazato-maru.

sen.j: 広沢局が眼病治癒のお礼に仏像を祀ったのがきっかけだとされる。
sen.e: It is said that Hirosawa no tsubone enshrined an image of Buddha there, as a token of gratitude for cure of her eye disease, which led to the erection of Koutaku-ji Temple.
It is said that Hirosawa no tsubone enshrined an image of Buddha there, as a token of gratitude for cure of her eye disease, which led the building of Kotaku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: to the erection→the building,Koutaku→Kotaku と修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that Hirosawa no tsubone enshrined an image of Buddha there, as a token of gratitude for cure of her eye disease, which led the building of Kotaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1593年の8月に秀吉は大阪に帰り、名護屋城には二度と戻ってこなかった。
sen.e: After he went back to Osaka in August, 1593, he never returned to Nagoya-jo Castle.
After he went back to Osaka in August, 1593, he never returned to Nagoya-jo Castle.
After he went back to Osaka in August, 1593, he never returned to Nagoya-jo Castle.

sen.j: 1598年、彼女はなおも名護屋城の山里丸に住んでいたが、8月に秀吉が死去すると、既に兄の名護屋経述が死去していたこともあり、出家した。
sen.e: In 1598, Hirosawa no tsubone still lived in Yamazato-maru of Nagoya-jo Castle, however, when Hideyoshi died in August, and yet, since her brother, Tsunenobu NAGOYA, had already died, she became a priest.

In 1598, Hirosawa no tsubone was still living in Yamazato-maru of Nagoya-jo Castle, however, when Hideyoshi died in August, and, since her brother, Tsunenobu NAGOYA, had already died, she entered the nunhood.
sen.cmt: still lived→was still living,and yet→and,”出家した”の部分を修正しました。（この場合は女性であるため）

She died in 1637.
